content:
If you're looking for a white wine to pair with pork belly, you may want to consider a wine that has enough acidity to cut through the rich and fatty flavors of the dish.

One option that I would suggest is an Alsatian Pinot Gris, which is a white wine grown in the Alsace region of France. This wine has a medium to full body and a high level of acidity, making it a great match for pork belly. It has flavors of ripe stone fruit, citrus, and honey, which complement the sweet and savory flavors of the pork belly.

Another option that would pair well with pork belly is a dry Riesling from Germany. These wines have high acidity, with flavors of green apple, lime, and mineral notes. They are a great match for pork belly, as the acidity cuts through the richness of the dish, while the fruit flavors complement the pork's sweetness.

Ultimately, the best pairing for pork belly will depend on your personal taste preferences, the preparation of the dish, and the style of wine that you prefer. I would recommend experimenting with different wine pairings to find the one that you enjoy the most.
